conclusion: Describes the motion after the motorcycle leaves the platform
The motorcycle rides off the platform edge horizontally with speed v₀x = 3 m/s
Initial vertical velocity is zero: v₀y = 0
The platform is 0.8 m higher than point A (ground level)
Air resistance is neglected, so horizontal velocity is constant and vertical motion is free fall with acceleration g = 10 m/s² downward
Calculates time of flight until reaching point A using vertical displacement y = ½ g t²
Solves for t² = 0.16 and t = √0.16 = 0.40 s
